author: Camila Gonzalez Staff Writer
title: Mellow Mushroom closing after more than 13 years in downtown Denton | News | fbherald.com
text:
Pizza restaurant Mellow Mushroom announced Wednesday via social media that it will close "indefinitely" this Sunday.
Mellow Mushroom began in 1974 in Atlanta and has franchises throughout the country. The locally owned Denton location, at 217 E. Hickory St., opened in 2011 and became a staple restaurant for some folks. The restaurant is part of the Denton Main Street Association.
"Anytime we see a business close downtown, it's definitely something that we don't like to see," association President Kristen Kendrick Bigley said Wednesday. "But there's many reasons why businesses make that decision."
Local residents have shared their thoughts on Mellow Mushroom closing and their memories of the restaurant.
University of North Texas alumnus and sports videographer David Horn said he remembers visiting the restaurant frequently with fellow members of coed service fraternity Alpha Phi Omega after service events and meetings.
"It was always a good environment," Horn said.
Denton-based vintage clothing vendor Jacob Kerstetter had mixed memories.

author: bnagy
title: Fundraiser established for fallen Local 528 member - SMART Union
text: It is with deep sorrow and heavy hearts that we announce the tragic passing of our brother and colleague, Austin Raysby. Brother Raysby, a valued member of SMART-TD Local 528 in Chicago who worked as a conductor for Union Pacific, was tragically killed while on duty Sept. 4. Brother Raysby joined SMART-TD in 2012. Known throughout the crew room for his infectious positivity and fun-loving nature, he brought a lightness and camaraderie that was cherished by all who worked alongside him. His spirit and enthusiasm made him a true friend to his brothers and sisters at UP. Members of Local 528 knew Austin as a solid railroader and a genuinely good person who was always willing to lend a helping hand and share a laugh. His presence and energy will be deeply missed by all who had the honor of working with him. As our brothers and sisters in Local 528 know, Austin’s presence made a bad day seem tolerable. Every crew base has one guy who everyone loves to see in the crew room. Brother Raysby was that guy. When you had a bad round trip, and all you wanted to do was mark off your ticket and go home, if you saw Austin, you couldn’t help but talk to him for a few minutes. And somehow, you left work feeling that everything made sense and was okay. In addition to his work family in Local 528, Austin is survived by his loving parents, three siblings, and numerous nieces and nephews, all of whom will remember him for his warmth and kindness. During this profoundly difficult time, the entire SMART-TD community extends its condolences and prayers to his family, friends, and his union family in Local 528. In honor of Brother Raysby, SMART-TD has established a GoFundMe fundraiser to assist his family with his final expenses. [Donations can be made to support them through this challenging period.](https://www.gofundme.com/f/honor-austin-raysby-help-with-final-expenses?qid=eebb5798042b8fda3a4ab37b8fa466d5) A memorial service to celebrate Austin’s life will be held on Sept. 19 from 3 p.m. to 7 p.m. at Strang Funeral Chapel & Crematorium, 410 E. Belvidere Road, Grayslake, Ill. All who knew him are invited to attend and pay their respects. author: Daniele Maglie
title: Seconda notte di coprifuoco a Los Angeles, la protesta contro i raid anti immigrati si allarga in altre città
text:
E' iniziata la seconda notte di coprifuoco a Los Angeles, decisa dalla sindaca Karen Bass per contenere le proteste per i raid anti-immgrati decisa da Trump. Nelle ultime ore non sono stati segnalati nuovi scontri. La portavoce della Casa Bianca Karoline Leavitt ribadisce la linea decisa da Trump: "Andremo avanti con le deportazioni. Restano i militari della Guardia Nazionale e i Marines. Intanto le proteste contro gli immigrati irregolari si stanno allargando a tutto il Paese, da New York a Chicago, Atlanta e San Francisco. Il segretario alla Difesa Pete Hegseth non esclude l'invio della Guardia Nazionale in altri Stati.
Cosa succede a Los Angeles Seconda notte di coprifuoco a Los Angeles, dove gli arresti, dall'inizio delle proteste, sono ormai centinaia, mentre i sindaci della della contea nella quale si trova la principale città della California chiedono a Trump di interrompere le retate anti-clandestini indiscriminate condotte da venerdì scorso dall'Ice, l'agenzia federale per il controllo dei flussi migratori.
Karoline Bass: "Il coprifuoco andrà avanti" "Il coprifuoco, ha affermato la prima cittadina di Los Angeles, Karen Bass, andra' avanti per tutto il tempo che sara' necessario: Dipendera' dal comportamento dei federali dispiegati senza necessità dall'amministrazione e che sta provocando le proteste"
Uomini della guardia nazionale e 700 marines sono stati inviati da Trump per fronteggiare le manifestazioni che vanno avanti da giorni contro le sue politiche migratorie e che ormai si stanno espandendo a macchia d'olio in tutto il paese.
La protesta si estende in altre città New York, Boston, Chicago, San Francisco, Atlanta, varie città del Texas. Anche in queste ultime, il governatore repubblicano Abbott ha annunciato lo schieramento della guardia nazionale.
Coprifuoco e stato di emergenza sono stati proclamati anche a Spokane, nello stato di Washington.
Trump non si ferma Trump, però, non si ferma e anzi rilancia, non escludendo il ricorso all'Insurrection Act, che prevede l'utilizzo dell'esercito per sedare le rivolte interne.
"Senza di me Los Angeles starebbe bruciando" Accolto da un misto di contestazioni e applausi al Kennedy Center, a Washington, dove ha assistito a un musical, ha descritto i manifestanti come pazzi radicali di sinistra, in molti casi pagati, e affermato che senza di lui Los Angeles in questo momento starebbe bruciando.
